Master Answer:
The BC Centre for Disease Control (BCCDC) does not have immunization coverage data for specific schools.  However, your local public health unit may have this information. You can find the contact information for your local public health unit here. 
The BCCDC does however have immunization coverage data at the provincial/health authority/health service delivery area level for children at their second birthday and school-aged children. You can find the BCCDC immunization coverage reports here. 
- Immunization Nurse
Master Question: If I have an immunocompromised, but healthy, child in school how do I find out if other children have up to date vaccination schedules in order to protect my child to the best of my ability?
Master Question variation 0: what age to check vaccine schedule in school
